name: Avoid delete operators to exit with an exception.
description:
The rule will throw a violation if the following exit with an exception:

Delete Operator
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Delete operators are typically called from destructors, and so a delete operator that throws an exception is likely to cause an exception to be thrown from a destructor.
reference:
AUTOSAR 2014 C++, A15-5-1: A class destructor, “delete” operators, move constructor, move assignment operator and “swap” function shall not exit with an exception. They shall be all specified as “noexcept”.

CERT C++ DCL57-CPP. Do not let exceptions escape from destructors or deallocation functions
total: Total number of Desctructors, Delete Operators, Swap Functions, Move and Move Assignment Operators
alternativeName: Avoid delete operators to exit with an exception.
